# focusRectOfInterest

**Instance Property**

The device’s current focus rectangle of interest, if it has one.

## Declaration

```swift
var focusRectOfInterest: CGRect { get set }
```

## Discussion

The value of this property is a `CGRect` determining the device’s focus rectangle of interest. Use this as an alternative to setting [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/focusPointOfInterest], as it allows you to specify both a location and size. For example, a value of `CGRectMake(0, 0, 1, 1)` tells the device to use the entire field of view when determining the focus, while `CGRectMake(0, 0, 0.25, 0.25)` indicates the top left sixteenth, and `CGRectMake(0.75, 0.75, 0.25, 0.25)` indicates the bottom right sixteenth. Setting [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/focusRectOfInterest] throws an `NSInvalidArgumentException` if [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/isFocusRectOfInterestSupported] returns `false`. Setting [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/focusRectOfInterest] throws an `NSInvalidArgumentException` if your provided rectangle’s size is smaller than the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/minFocusRectOfInterestSize]. Setting [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/focusRectOfInterest] throws an `NSGenericException` if you call it without first obtaining exclusive access to the device using [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/lockForConfiguration()]. Setting [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/focusRectOfInterest] updates the device’s [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/focusPointOfInterest] to the center of your provided rectangle of interest. If you later set the device’s [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/focusPointOfInterest], the [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/focusRectOfInterest] resets to the default sized rectangle of interest for the new focus point of interest. If you change your [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/activeFormat], the point of interest and rectangle of interest both revert to their default values. You can observe automatic changes to the device’s [doc://com.apple.avfoundation/documentation/AVFoundation/AVCaptureDevice/focusRectOfInterest] by key-value observing this property.



## Setting a focus rectangle of interest

- **isFocusRectOfInterestSupported**: Whether the receiver supports focus rectangles of interest.
- **minFocusRectOfInterestSize**: The minimum size you may use when specifying a rectangle of interest.
- **defaultRectForFocusPoint(ofInterest:)**: The default rectangle of interest used for a given focus point of interest.
